perturbation.original_text: i. In any consecutive three (3) month period in which the difference between the Card Inventory Forecast less the actual Card Order volume for that period is a shortage of ten percent or greater (10%+), AEIS reserves the right to assess a penalty, ("Card Inventory Penalty") of sixteen and one-half cents ($0.165) per Card for such difference as detailed in Examples 1 and 2 below.
perturbation.changed_text: i. In any consecutive three (3) month period in which the difference between the Card Inventory Forecast less the actual Card Order volume for that period is a shortage of ten percent or greater (10%+), AEIS reserves the right to assess a penalty, ("Card Inventory Penalty") for such difference as detailed in Examples 1 and 2 below.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the amount of the card inventory penalty, the text creates an internal contradiction. The modified text still references a 'Card Inventory Penalty,' but the specific amount is undefined. This makes the contract difficult to enforce because the penalty cannot be calculated.

perturbation.original_text: k. CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS. The full risk of loss for ordered Cards shall pass to Schoolpop immediately upon their delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS and AEIS shall not reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to as "Loss"). Schoolpop shall remain solely liable for any Loss caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of its employees, agents or representatives after the shipment has been received by Schoolpop. AEIS will not reimburse Schoolpop or its Client or be responsible for any Loss in connection with or after delivery of Cards to Schoolpop, its Clients or the Cardholder whether they are shipped to Schoolpop, its Client, or to either of their pre-designated delivery agents. Only Cardholders are eligible to receive replacements from AEIS and replacements are given only in accordance with the agreement between the Cardholder and AEIS. Cards are usually shipped in packaging with AEIS' designated vendor as the return address. Notwithstanding the foregoing, AEIS shall bear no risk of Loss and of non-receipt of Cards by the intended Cardholder in the event that AEIS is instructed to use another address as the return address, the address provided to AEIS for Schoolpop or the Client was incorrect, the request for the Card was unauthorized, and/or any information received by AEIS with regard to the processing of the Order was fraudulent or incorrect.
perturbation.changed_text: The full risk of loss for ordered Cards shall pass to Schoolpop immediately upon their delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS and AEIS shall not reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to as "Loss"). Schoolpop shall remain solely liable for any Loss caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of its employees, agents or representatives after the shipment has been received by Schoolpop. AEIS will not reimburse Schoolpop or its Client or be responsible for any Loss in connection with or after delivery of Cards to Schoolpop, its Clients or the Cardholder whether they are shipped to Schoolpop, its Client, or to either of their pre-designated delivery agents. Only Cardholders are eligible to receive replacements from AEIS and replacements are given only in accordance with the agreement between the Cardholder and AEIS. Cards are usually shipped in packaging with AEIS' designated vendor as the return address. Notwithstanding the foregoing, AEIS shall bear no risk of Loss and of non-receipt of Cards by the intended Cardholder in the event that AEIS is instructed to use another address as the return address, the address provided to AEIS for Schoolpop or the Client was incorrect, the request for the Card was unauthorized, and/or any information received by AEIS with regard to the processing of the Order was fraudulent or incorrect.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the sentence 'CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS', the text creates an ambiguity and internal contradiction. The text now does not state who is responsible if the cards are lost in transit from AEIS which leaves the previous sentences without definition and in conflict.

perturbation.original_text: e. Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, the cumulative liability of the parties to one another for any claims, liabilities, losses, damages or expenses, direct or indirect, arising out of or related to this Agreement shall not exceed the lesser of $50,000 or (not including other funding amounts such as the Point value of Cards) or the amount paid by Schoolpop to AEIS for the immediately preceding twelve (12) months provided, however, that in no event shall this limitation of liability apply to any claims, liabilities, losses, damages, or expenses, direct or indirect, arising out of or related to this Agreement brought by the actions of Schoolpop pursuant to paragraphs 4(e), 4(i), 4(k), 4(p), 5(a), 5(b), 6(b), 7(a), 7(d), 14(d.iii), 9(f) and Sections 2, 3 11, 12, and 13, and Exhibit 1 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: e. Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, the cumulative liability of the parties to one another for any claims, liabilities, losses, damages or expenses, direct or indirect, arising out of or related to this Agreement shall not exceed the lesser of $50,000 or (not including other funding amounts such as the Point value of Cards) or the amount paid by Schoolpop to AEIS for the immediately preceding twelve (12) months.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the part 'provided, however, that in no event shall this limitation of liability apply to any claims, liabilities, losses, damages, or expenses, direct or indirect, arising out of or related to this Agreement brought by the actions of Schoolpop pursuant to paragraphs 4(e), 4(i), 4(k), 4(p), 5(a), 5(b), 6(b), 7(a), 7(d), 14(d.iii), 9(f) and Sections 2, 3 11, 12, and 13, and Exhibit 1 of this Agreement.', there is a contradiction because it implies there are no exceptions to the rule about liabilities; however, some sections may have clauses which discuss liabilities regardless.
